message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the double replacement reaction between sodium chloride and silver nitrate, and what are the spectator ions in the reaction?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the double replacement reaction between sodium chloride (NaCl) and silver nitrate (AgNO3) is:

NaCl (aq) + AgNO3 (aq) â†’ NaNO3 (aq) + AgCl (s)

In this reaction, the sodium (Na+) and nitrate (NO3-) ions are the spectator ions, as they do not participate in the formation of the product and remain in the solution.
